maml:description.maml:para: {{ Adds a DACL to an SMBSecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ Adds a DACL to an SMBSecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be added. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

{{ The DACL being added to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must originate from Copy-SMBSecurityDACL or New-SMBSecurityDACL and the DACL's SecurityDescriptor property must match the SecurityDescriptor's Name, because each SMB SecurityDescriptor has a unique set of rights. Attempting to add a DACL with a mismatched SMBSecurityDescriptor will result in an error. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}

{{ The DACL being added to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must originate from Copy-SMBSecurityDACL or New-SMBSecurityDACL and the DACL's SecurityDescriptor property must match the SecurityDescriptor's Name, because each SMB SecurityDescriptor has a unique set of rights. Attempting to add a DACL with a mismatched SMBSecurityDescriptor will result in an error. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be added. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ The SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD) is assigned to $SD. A DACL that Allows the "Authenticated Users" special identity group FullControl is create. Then the DACL is then added to the SD. NOTE: This does not save the change to the system. See Save-SMBSecurity. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates a file-based copy of an SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). }}

{{ Creates a file-based copy of an SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). Individual SMB SDs are written as XML files. A full, or registry, backup file is written as a REG file. These files can by used by Restore-SMBSecurity to quickly revert changes. When no backup path is set the automatic backup path is used: %LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity. }}

{{ The name(s) of the SMB SecurityDescriptor(s) to be backed up. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}
{{ Sets the backup path. The automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used when the path is not set or is invalid. }}
{{ Returns an array of full paths to each file created by Backup-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ Only a full registry export-based backup is created. Individual backups using XML files are not created. }}
{{ Creates a full registry export-based backup in addition to the individual XML-based backup. }}
{{ Returns an array of full paths to each file created by Backup-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ Sets the backup path. The automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used when the path is not set or is invalid. }}
{{ Only a full registry export-based backup is created. Individual backups using XML files are not created. }}

{{ The name(s) of the SMB SecurityDescriptor(s) to be backed up. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}
{{ Creates a full registry export-based backup in addition to the individual XML-based backup. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Backup-SMBSecurity }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Backs up all SMB Security Descriptors (SD) individually. A total of 14 XML files will be created in the automatic backup path %LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity (PowerShell: $ENV:LOCALAPPDATA\SMBSecurity). }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Backup-SMBSecurity -RegOnly }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Backs up all SMB Security Descriptors (SD) to a single REG file. The files will be saved to the automatic backup path, %LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Backup-SMBSecurity -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo -Path C:\Backups\SMBSecurity -WithReg }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Backs up the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor to an XML file, and all SMB Security Descriptors (SD) to a single REG file. The files will be saved to the custom backup path, C:\Backups\SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $files = Backup-SMBSecurity -Path C:\Backups\SMBSecurity -WithReg -FilePassThru }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ All SMB SecurityDescriptor will be backed up individually to XML files and as a single REG file. The files will be saved to the custom backup path, C:\Backups\SMBSecurity. The full file paths will be returned and stored in the $files variable. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates a cloned copy of a DACL. }}
{{ Creates a cloned copy of a DACL. This is used by the modify DACL process in conjunction with Set-SmbSecurityDescriptorDACL. }}
{{ The DACL object to be copied. In general, this should be a DACL in an SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}
{{ The DACL object to be copied. In general, this should be a DACL in an SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ This example creates a copy of the "Authenticated Users" DACL. The copied DACL is modified and then used to update the SMBSecurityDescriptor. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Retrieves one or more SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}

{{ Retrieves one or more SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD) from the local registry. The SDs are converted into an SMBSecurityDescriptor object that can be used to modify the SMB server security capabilities of the Windows computer. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Get-SMBSecurity }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Returns an array of SMBSecurityDescriptors for all SMB SDs on the system. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $sdDefaultShareInfo = Get-SMBSecurity -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Returns a single SMBSecurityDescriptor object for SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Returns a brief SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD) description for a given SD name. }}
{{ Returns a brief SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD) description for a given SD name. All SMB SD name and descriptions are returned when no name is passed. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Get-SMBSecurityDescription }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Returns the name and description of all SMB SecurityDescriptors. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Get-SMBSecurityDescription -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Returns the description of the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptors. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Returns a list of all SMB SecurityDescriptor names. }}
{{ Returns a list of all SMB SecurityDescriptor names. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Get-SMBSecurityDescriptorName }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Returns a list of all SMB SecurityDescriptor names. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Returns a hashtable of valid rights for the given SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). }}

{{ Returns a hashtable of valid rights for the given SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). The hashtable invludes the right name, which is used other SMBSecurity cmdlets like Set-SMBSecurityDACL, with its corresponding DACL value. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Get-SMBSecurityDescriptorRight -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Outputs a hashtable of valid rights for the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SD. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates a DACL for a specific SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). }}
{{ Creates a DACL for a specific SMB SecurityDescriptor (SD). A DACL must be created for a specific SMB SD because each DACL has a unique set of rights. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}
{{ Allow or Deny the the Right(s) for the Account. Please note that Deny overrules Allow. }}
{{ What permissions the account will (Allow) or will not (Deny) have for SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The user account or group that the Right(s) will apply to. }}
{{ Allow or Deny the the Right(s) for the Account. Please note that Deny overrules Allow. }}
{{ The user account or group that the Right(s) will apply to. }}
{{ What permissions the account will (Allow) or will not (Deny) have for SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ This sample creates a DACL for the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor. This DACL object can be added to an SMBSecurityDescriptor object to modify the permission set. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates an SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}

{{ Creates an SMBSecurityDescriptor object. This cmdlet can be used in advanced scripting scenarios. The recommendation is to use Get-SMBSecurity and modify the esisting SMB SecurityDescriptor rather than building the SMBSecurityDescriptor manually. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}
{{ Creates the SMBSecurityDescriptor based on a compatible SDDL string. }}
{{ The owner of the Security Descriptor. This should be 'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'. }}
{{ The primary group for the Security Descriptor. This should be 'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'. }}

{{ An array of one or more DACLs to add to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must originate from Copy-SMBSecurityDACL or New-SMBSecurityDACL and the DACL's SecurityDescriptor property must match the SecurityDescriptor's Name, because each SMB SecurityDescriptor has a unique set of rights. Attempting to add a DACL with a mismatched SMBSecurityDescriptor will result in an error. }}

{{ An array of one or more DACLs to add to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must originate from Copy-SMBSecurityDACL or New-SMBSecurityDACL and the DACL's SecurityDescriptor property must match the SecurityDescriptor's Name, because each SMB SecurityDescriptor has a unique set of rights. Attempting to add a DACL with a mismatched SMBSecurityDescriptor will result in an error. }}
{{ The primary group for the Security Descriptor. This should be 'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'. }}
{{ The owner of the Security Descriptor. This should be 'NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM'. }}
{{ Creates the SMBSecurityDescriptor based on a compatible SDDL string. }}

{{ The name of the SMB SecurityDescriptor. The valid set of names are: SrvsvcConfigInfo, SrvsvcConnection, SrvsvcFile, SrvsvcServerDiskEnum, SrvsvcSessionInfo, SrvsvcShareAdminConnect, SrvsvcShareAdminInfo, SrvsvcShareChange, SrvsvcShareConnect, SrvsvcShareFileInfo, SrvsvcSharePrintInfo, SrvsvcStatisticsInfo, SrvsvcTransportEnum, and SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Creates a complete, new SMBSecurityDescriptor from scratch. This can be used to replace the existing SMB SD.
WARNING! This method should be used with extreme caution! Microsoft does not recommend using this method without significant testing and the understanding that this could cause unexpected results. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates an SMBSecGroup object. }}
{{ Creates an SMBSecGroup object. The group can be added to the SMBSecurityDescriptor via Set-SMBSecurityGroup. The command will fail if the account's SID cannot be resolved by the system. }}

{{ The group name. String SID or account/group name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in '[username|group]', 'domain\[username|group]', and '[username|group]@domain' format. }}

{{ [Experimental] Certain domain configurations, namely Azure AD joined, may cause the Account lookup to fail. This parameter adds extra domain lookup logic that should be AAD compatible. Hybrid joined and traditional AD joined systems should not need this parameter. }}

{{ The group name. String SID or account/group name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in '[username|group]', 'domain\[username|group]', and '[username|group]@domain' format. }}

{{ [Experimental] Certain domain configurations, namely Azure AD joined, may cause the Account lookup to fail. This parameter adds extra domain lookup logic that should be AAD compatible. Hybrid joined and traditional AD joined systems should not need this parameter. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $account = "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" }} PS C:\> {{ $Group = New-SMBSecurityGroup -Account $account }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Creates an SMBSecurity Group using the SYSTEM account. This is the recommended group account. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Creates an SMBSecOwner object. }}
{{ Creates an SMBSecOwner object. The owner can be added to the SMBSecurityDescriptor via Set-SMBSecurityOwner. The command will fail if the account's SID cannot be resolved by the system. }}

{{ The owner name. String SID or account name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in 'username', 'domain\username', and 'user@domain' format. }}

{{ [Experimental] Certain domain configurations, namely Azure AD joined, may cause the Account lookup to fail. This parameter adds extra domain lookup logic that should be AAD compatible. Hybrid joined and traditional AD joined systems should not need this parameter. }}

{{ The owner name. String SID or account name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in 'username', 'domain\username', and 'user@domain' format. }}

{{ [Experimental] Certain domain configurations, namely Azure AD joined, may cause the Account lookup to fail. This parameter adds extra domain lookup logic that should be AAD compatible. Hybrid joined and traditional AD joined systems should not need this parameter. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $account = "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" }} PS C:\> {{ $Owner = New-SMBSecurityOwner -Account $account }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Creates an SMBSecurity Owner using the SYSTEM account. This is the recommended owner account. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Removes a DACL from an SMBSecurityDescriptor. }}

{{ Removes a DACL from an SMBSecurityDescriptor. This does not commit the change to the system, it only modifies the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The Save-SMBSecurity cmdlet is used to commit changes to a SMBSecurityDescriptor to the system. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be removed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ The DACL being removed to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must be an exact match to a DACL in the SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}
{{ The DACL being removed to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must be an exact match to a DACL in the SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be removed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ This example removes the Everyone group DACL from the SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Removes a DACL from an SMBSecurityDescriptor. }}

{{ Removes a DACL from an SMBSecurityDescriptor. This does not commit the change to the system, it only modifies the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The Save-SMBSecurity cmdlet is used to commit changes to a SMBSecurityDescriptor to the system. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be removed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ The DACL being removed to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must be an exact match to a DACL in the SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}
{{ The DACL being removed to the SMBSecurityDescriptor. The DACL must be an exact match to a DACL in the SMBSecurityDescriptor object. }}
{{ Outputs the modified SMBSecurityDescriptor to the success stream. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL should be removed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ This example removes the Everyone group DACL from the SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Commits changes made to SMBSecurityDescriptor(s) to the system. }}
{{ Commits changes made to SMBSecurityDescriptor(s) to the system. Running this command will automatically generate a backup prior to the committing the change. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object to be committed to the registry. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ Path to the directory (folder) where backups will be written to. The automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used when this parameter is not set. }}

{{ Creates a full registry-based backup in addition to individual XML-based backup(s). The BackupPath is honored, when set; otherwise, the automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used. }}
{{ By default, changes are not committed to the system when the backup fails. The Force parameter will commit changes even if the backup fails. }}
{{ Path to the directory (folder) where backups will be written to. The automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used when this parameter is not set. }}

{{ Creates a full registry-based backup in addition to individual XML-based backup(s). The BackupPath is honored, when set; otherwise, the automatic backup path (%LOCALAPPDATA%\SMBSecurity) is used. }}
{{ By default, changes are not committed to the system when the backup fails. The Force parameter will commit changes even if the backup fails. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object to be committed to the registry. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ This example removes the Everyone group DACL from the SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor, and then saves the change to the system. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Alters the settings of an SMB Security Descriptor (SD) DACL. }}
{{ Alters the settings of an SMB Security Descriptor (SD) DACL. }}
{{ The DACL object being modified. }}
{{ The user account or group that the Right(s) will apply to. }}
{{ Allow or Deny the the Right(s) for the Account. Please note that Deny overrules Allow. }}
{{ What permissions the account will (Allow) or will not (Deny) have for SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ Outputs the results to the success stream. }}
{{ Allow or Deny the the Right(s) for the Account. Please note that Deny overrules Allow. }}
{{ The user account or group that the Right(s) will apply to. }}
{{ The DACL object being modified. }}
{{ Outputs the results to the success stream. }}
{{ What permissions the account will (Allow) or will not (Deny) have for SMB SecurityDescriptor. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Creates the SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SMBSecurityDescriptor and then copies the DACL using the DomainGroup account. The DACL is modified to Deny this group access to SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SD. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Replaces the existing DACL in an SecurityDescriptor with a modified version of that DACL. }}
{{ Replaces the existing DACL in an SecurityDescriptor with a modified version of that DACL. The NewDACL should be created using Copy-SMBSecurityDACL. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL is being replaced. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}
{{ The existing DACL that is being replaced. }}
{{ The DACL replacing the existing one in the SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The existing DACL that is being replaced. }}
{{ The DACL replacing the existing one in the SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the DACL is being replaced. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Creates the SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SMBSecurityDescriptor and then copies the DACL using the DomainGroup account. The DACL is modified to Deny this group access to SrvsvcSharePrintInfo SD. The changes are updated to the SMB SD. }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Replaces the Group in a SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ Replaces the Group in a SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the Owner will be changed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

{{ The group name. String SID or account/group name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in '[username|group]', 'domain\[username|group]', and '[username|group]@domain' format. }}
{{ Returns the result to the success stream. }}

{{ The group name. String SID or account/group name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in '[username|group]', 'domain\[username|group]', and '[username|group]@domain' format. }}
{{ Returns the result to the success stream. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the Owner will be changed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $SD = Get-SMBSecurity -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo }} PS C:\> {{ Set-SMBSecurityGroup -SecurityDescriptor $SMBSec -Account "Administrators" }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Changes the primary group of the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor to the Administrators group.
WARNING! Extreme caution should be used when chaning SMB SecurityDescriptor group! }}

maml:description.maml:para: {{ Replaces the Owner in a SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ Replaces the Owner in a SecurityDescriptor. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the Owner will be changed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

{{ The owner name. String SID or account name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in 'username', 'domain\username', and 'user@domain' format. }}
{{ Returns the result to the success stream. }}

{{ The owner name. String SID or account name, [System.Security.Principal.NTAccount], [System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier] (SID), [SMBSecAccount], and ,[SMBSecGroup] objects are accepted. Strings accept input in 'username', 'domain\username', and 'user@domain' format. }}
{{ Returns the result to the success stream. }}
{{ The SMBSecurityDescriptor object where the Owner will be changed. The SMBSecurityDescriptor object must originate from Get-SMBSecurity. }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ $SD = Get-SMBSecurity -SecurityDescriptorName SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo }} PS C:\> {{ Set-SMBSecurityOwner -SecurityDescriptor $SMBSec -Account "Administrator" }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: {{ Changes the owner of the SrvsvcDefaultShareInfo SMB SecurityDescriptor to the Administrator account.
WARNING! Extreme caution should be used when chaning SMB SecurityDescriptor owner! }}
